title: Elite Plus Magazine | Anand Panyarachun And The Making Of Modern Thailand

quotes: When Anand Panyarachun was named prime minister of Thailand following the coup d’etat of 1991
Anand, now 86, had in 1967, at the young age of 36, been named Ambassador and Acting Permanent Representative of Thailand to the United Nations
He remained in these posts until 1972, when he became Thailand’s ambassador to the United States
He remained in these posts until 1972, when he became Thailand’s ambassador to the United States while continuing in his role at the United Nations into 1975.
Then, a year after returning from his overseas postings to become Permanent Secretary at the Foreign Ministry in 1976
It took until January 1977 for Anand to be exonerated

quotes: Dominic had over six years to complete this book, but as Dominic explained it wasn’t full time as he was also working as a journalist and serving as president of the Foreign Correspondents Club of Thailand (FCCT) for part of this period.
When Anand Panyarachun was named prime minister of Thailand following the coup d’etat of 1991
Anand, now 86, had in 1967, at the young age of 36, been named Ambassador and Acting Permanent Representative of Thailand to the United Nations and concurrently Ambassador to Canada.
He remained in these posts until 1972, when he became Thailand’s ambassador to the United States while continuing in his role at the United Nations into 1975.
It took until January 1977 for Anand to be exonerated after which he became Thailand’s Ambassador to West Germany.
